Across the globe, 1 in 10 babies are born preterm. In addition to respiratory care, these unstable babies have three main needs: prevention of infection, early provision of breast milk, and thermal care. Enter immediate Kangaroo Mother Care (iKMC), an intervention that meets all three. iKMC, named for and inspired by the way kangaroos continuously carry their joeys in their pouches, promotes skin-to-skin contact between mothers and their newborns. It empowers women by making them active partners in the care of their sick newborn. And the best part: this game-changing technique is gaining traction all around the world. Discover how this innovation is both saving babies' lives and keeping mothers healthier and happier: https://lnkd.in/gkYmWni3
